BTOOOM!, a name you may have heard before, and might have remembered because of how strange of a name it really is. BTOOOM! is an exciting show, to say the least. However, like every other show of it's kind, there will be flaws. These flaws may be based on preference, however most are logical flaws that I will soon point out. Let it also be known that there will be praise involved as well. And so It begins. 
Story - 7
BTOOOM! caters to the audience that you would expect most anime watchers to be- nerd like kids to adults who spend most of their dayon the internet, and mainly playing games. You could also say that it attempts to side with viewers whom are NEET, or those who are young and Not in Education, Employment, or Training. I give this show props for not having players sucked into the BTOOOM! game, like the well known Sword Art Online, but rather sent to a real life replica of it, and expected to kill other 'players' in order to go home. The situation of them being sent is a bit realistic, since the US Army has scouted top ranked shooting game players before. However, there is a giant thing I have wrong with this. If you throw 30 gamers onto an island with a bunch of bombs, do you think they would actually run around and kill each other? If they truly are such gamers to a large extent, they will most likely have no physical endurance or strength what-so-ever, nor the will to kill another human being. That is for most, anyway. There are many things I can argue with the story line, but it's at least a little good.


Art - 9


I was actually very surprised at how nice the art for this series was. It was mainly very fluid and pleasant to look at, especially the semi-realism take. I have to say, their eyes were gorgeous. Actually, all of the character art and animations were lovely. The show handled nature and explosions relatively well, which is definitely good because those are two things we see very often. The bad parts of the art would be when we see people from a distance, as with most anime. However, you can't say that every anime has blob faced people at a distance, because there are some out there that actually put in the time. Despite this, I'm quite happy with the art. The opening and closing arts were nice, even if the ending song's art was just some pretty pictures panning across the screen.


Sound - 7


This is the one section that is purely based on preference. I just have to say that I love Nano, and she is the one who did the opening for BTOOOM!. The opening does get you hyped for the episode to start, which is what themes are mainly for. The ending song didn't really stand out much to me, so I don't have any comments on it. I watched the sub, and it was good in my opinion. I've never exactly heard a 'bad' japanese dub before, except for Elfen Lied. I'm sure there are more out there, but I probably haven't seen them. None of the background tracks really stood out much, which is why this section has a 7 from me.


Characters - 6


The characters in this series were okay at best. Let's look at the two main characters.


Ryota Sakamoto - Male protagonist


Sakamoto is, how do you put it, kind of weak? You always want your main character to be strong and cool, but this guy took 10 minutes of an episode trying to figure out how a BIM (bomb) works, when he had the most basic type. Not to mention, he's supposedly on the top 10 leaderboard for the game BTOOOM!? I get that the whole situation was a shock, but you would think he would know. His character design reminded me a lot of Light Yagami from Death Note, which puts it out there that his design wasn't exactly very unique. He wasn't completely spineless, and wasn't dumb the whole way through either. He just could have been smarter.


Himiko - Female protagonist 


Not the only girl in the show, but every guy seems to think she is, since they all try something nasty with her at some point or another. She didn't get in the way enough for me to hate her, and even though she had serious trust issues with men, she had a right to. Her character design is basic. The only thing that makes her unique is that her eyes are way too far apart. The fact that her and Sakamoto were married in game was a bit.. cringe worthy. It just reminded me of those 10 year olds that get married in Minecraft. I have an issue with how everything about her is very sexual. Like how she has super big boobs and has gotten sexually assaulted way too many times. Her personality isn't bad, just how the story treats her.


There are characters I love (the psycho kid) and characters I hate (the fat guy), as with every show. These feelings are at extremes, though. Short rant: why do all of the men have to be disgusting pigs in this show? It is just way too obvious that whoever wrote the story for this strongly disliked men in everything they do.


Personal enjoyment - 6


This anime was fun to watch, but there were times where I was questioning everything about it. It made me mad, happy, all of the above. When I finished, I couldn't decide if I liked it or not. The ending was bad, which probably didn't help. Watching any survival show is fun, though, no matter how bullshit it is.


Overall - 7


It was good, but definitely no masterpiece. It had many flaws. This reaction could also be partly because of the fact that it didn't wrap up in a neat little bow like we all would like. I would say to watch it and form your own opinion of it. You may love it, but you may hate it. Maybe the manga is better. I haven't read enough to differentiate the two. If you find yourself okay in dealing with what I've criticized, go ahead and enjoy yourself! 


Thank you for reading!

Btooom!
Is there a PC game you love to play? Imagine waking up in a real life version of said game. Only for Routa, its an fps with different types of  bomb.
Characters
Routa is our MC, he is ranked number 3 in the world at this game, and he is thrown onto an island with no idea why. 
Routa is a very believable character, he is smart and also very human.
Kill to survive, or let yourself be killed. It sounds straight forward, but, is it really?
Every character shows what humans can be pushed to, despair, abandonment, hope, greed and kindness/love.
Some of the scenes can be verymature, so beware. \n\n
Enjoyment\n
This was fantastic. I wont spoil anything, but there is action, violence, romance and a lot of great human emotion displayed by the characters. \n
The story kept me wanting more and more, I am sad that this is over.\n
You never know where it will go, which is something i loved about it. Or at least I didnt know where it was going. \n\n
Overall/Sound\n
The OP and ED are sooooo good. Especially the ED. The music through ought is fantastic. \n
If you want to watch an anime that packs all of the above, with a great MC.\n
then watch Btooom!

As a huge fan of the twisted survival game theme for anime/manga, I thought Btooom! would be the perfect anime for me. In some ways it was, but in other ways it started to let me down. However, there is no doubt that Btooom! was a highly entertaining watch that, even with it's flaws, was ultimately worth the watch.
Story: 8/10
Like I said, I'm biased towards this anime's story; I love the plots where humans are pitted against each other in a twisted game that tests their desire to survive as well as their sanity. I feel like this setup, while becoming less and less original,is a great storyline for a horror/psychological anime. 


Art: 9/10

There's no doubt that Btooom! is extremely well animated. Each of the character's designs fits their personalities, from the cute child psycho to the relatively ordinary NEET protagonist with a big heart. The only problem I had was sometimes the body-to-face proportions looked a little strange to me, mostly with Himiko. Her head was kind of a weird shape, but that could just be me. Either way, it's nothing to complain about.


Sound: 8/10

There isn't too much to say here. I really loved the OP (up until the last episode, where it was changed), and never really listened to the ED. The voice actors did a good job, and you could start to see in their voices when their mental state began to deteriorate.


Character: 9/10

This is where I think Btooom! really excels. I think all of the characters were likable or detestable, as needed, in their own way. My personal favorite would be Kira, who I think had a great background and was extremely disappointed when he didn't get more appearances later on in the anime. Even though he's a deranged sociopath, he still has that intrigue about him that makes you want to know more about him. I think when an anime makes a few of the "villains" likeable, they've done an excellent job of crafting their characters.

Himiko was a bit annoying at first; she seemed to exist simply for Ryouta to save. However, her back story (while not original in the least) was believeable and she started to redeem herself towards the very end. Speaking of Ryouta, I think he was a fantastic protagonist -- he wasn't wimpy, but he also wasn't a brutal killing machine. He had a sense of morals, but he wasn't like "NO I CAN NEVER KILL AT ALL!" which can be annoying in these kind of stories. Of course, the way he always managed to dodge BIMs simply because he was the main character was aggravating, but that doesn't really have anything to do with his character.


Enjoyment: 9/10

Btooom! is definitely worth watching simply for the enjoyment factor. No, it may not have an incredibly complex plot or huge mindfucks, but if you were to watch this anime after it had finished airing, it would be the kind of anime that you marathon. It's action-packed plot and interesting characters make each episode go by quickly, so even if you don't enjoy it, it should be a quick watch and is at least worth a chance.


Overall: 7/10

Based on my ratings for other factors, I should be giving this anime an 8 or 9. However, I have to give it a 7 simply for the ending. Throughout the second half of Btooom!, the focus shifted slightly to a romantic one. There was still action, but more of the time was spent with Ryouta and Himiko's relationship than badass bomb fighting. The ending was extremely disappointing in the fact that it had more focus on romance and wasn't really any unexpected twists at all; although based on the ending, I think there is high hope for a second season.

Overall, Btooom! is a great watch if you're looking for a survival anime with a world that sucks you in and keeps you on the edge of your seat, even if it is a little predictable at times.

I really like animes based on games. Some of my fav. were SAO, Overlord, Log Horizon, AccelWorld and No Game No Life. At first I was really into this one too, I watched like 8 episodes in a row. But the thing that bothered me kept getting worse. It was the lack of logic. Just stop trying to make sense of everything and you may like this anime.
I like animes where I can identify with the characters myself. I love it when I can predict the reactions of the main characters or at least make sense of it. It really frustates me when this IDIOTICmain character does this random ass things. I mean like, come on, even after being the freaking BEST player in Japan, why the hell does he rely on luck so much. Also there's just too much unnecessary drama. I never understand the logic behind explaining the plan to your enemy. Like seriously, why??

Guilty pleasure....Btoom!! does really well in all the departments. The characters are neither flowery nor unbelievably psychotic, they seem just apt for the story, their integrity holds all through. Some animes just take the character elements to extreme and exagerate, here it is justified. The Plot is simple, it brings elements of thriller, action, psychological and even ecchi elements together to form an exciting flow of events. One thing is definite though, its a spiced up version of Battle Royale meant for guilty pleasure.

Probable one of the least physiological, physiological-anime's I have ever seen, with only a few scenes where you actually want to go in and ******* kill the people for doing some messed up ****, but all in all, it was kinda fresh from where I stand, being the first survival-type-anime I have ever watched. Ok, now on with the review...
Story: 7/8 of 10
A newish story with some very good execution, but it shows very well how people give up and break so easily given the situation, some coincidences are way to far from normal, meeting a highschool ex-friend whom you nearly killed, and a girlyou only knew online who almost kills you, but it was all-in-all quite refreshing.


Art & Sound: 8.5/10


The art was different from your typical anime, but it was not a bad thing, the art was very good and clean, with attention to detail in the ruins and jungles, the sound was good, and it was very suitable for the scenes. The opening (no pain, no game) is probably my favorite OP, but the ending does not really suit the theme, being a nice and soft piano song.


Character: 8


This had development going for it, because people do snap and go mad easily, or change to trust people quicker. You can't really relate to any of the MC's, as they all did some stupid **** or just messed up so monumentally that I have never seen anything like it. It is nice to see how they start to get closer even during the hell of the game.


Overall I recommend this anime for people who have quite a strong heart, as this sometimes will disturb the feint-hearted , but it is full of action and adventure, overall I give this anime a 8/10 for the awesome themes and cool setting.

"Btoom!" is one series of the increasingly popular "survival game" genre. It comes with a few downsides,  such as extensive fan-service, and sexual content that is only appropriate for 17 and up, in my opinion. There's nothing particularly special about the art or the sound; however, the storytelling was well done. The various battles and predicaments in the survival game are just original enough to get you excited and curious. The main characters, if not terribly deep, are developed enough so that you can sincerely cheer them on as they try their best to survive. My favorite aspect of the series is the processby which candidates of the survival game are chosen. I can't give spoilers, so, if you like battle royale, you'll have to see for yourself and give "Btoom!" a try.

There wasn't a real conclusion, so I did not feel satisfied.
Another decent survival anime. This one goes all out with the violence and action. As always, the protagonist is adept at the challenges presented to him in this series.
The action scenes are fun to watch and you'll get curious as to how they can beat their opponents. 
However, none of the background story is fully developed. There is, however, explanations as to why the characters ended up in the survival game. But I kind of don't care for explanations if they're going to die quickly and be forgotten.

I can only assume that the creators of Btooom! took one long, hard look at the Hunger Games trilogy and said to each other: 'Cool story bro. Needs more bombs.'  
And so was born Btooom!
Story - Take a bunch of seemingly average people, give them some bombs and let them loose on each other and see what happens. The anecdotes into the human psyche asides, the story of Btooom falls into the pitfall of this sort of show. It can't have much of a story because the story itself cannot be flexible otherwise the premise of survival game doesn't really work. I mean howcan a survival game be played if the players aren't 100% focused on survival? Thankfully I like this sort of story so it wasn't unbearable.


Art - I don't take a huge amount of notice of artwork but Btooom! seems especially poor, considering it's a relatively recent anime. 


Sound - Again, not an area I take a massive amount of interest in. I liked the opening song but beyond that the soundtrack didn't stick out at all. Neither good nor bad.


Character - The shows saving grace, if you like. The characters are not at all who they seem to be at first. It becomes almost difficult to sympathise with some of them. Whilst each character has their own shady past in one way or another there's really obvious character growth issues here and that which hold this section back. These flaws are perhaps less obvious that some others.


Enjoyment - Watchable. In the end I finished it out of obligation more than anything. I wouldn't go back and rewatch though.


Overall - I came close to dropping it. But I didn't. By finishing it I can call it good enough. However I have to give Btooom! the distinction of being one of the worse anime I've finished watching

Story/Plot:
7/10 
I really really liked the concept of this anime. It was great. I think the story was unique, but it was lacking. I don't know how. It was just missing something and I can't put my finger on it. The psychological aspect of the anime was amazing. It's deep and thought provoking. It shows you how twisted humans can be. This is pretty much the only thing I actually liked about Btooom! 
Art/Sound: 
8/10
I think the art is very good. The dub and sub voices are actually pretty great if I do say so myself. The opening and ending songs were decent.
Characters:
2/10
The characters arewhat made the anime bad. I felt that the main character should've been I don't know, better. The main female character reminded me why I hate female characters in anime's and manga's so much. She was beyond annoying. Not just a little annoying, but beyond. Now. When you have one annoying main character, you're usually supposed to have one that's the OPPOSITE to kind of balance the characters out. You know what? I didn't get that. The main guy character was annoying too. He had his little "bad-ass" moments maybe once or twice. The only cool character was the dude with the glasses and he was on screen for like three minutes altogether. \n\n
Overall:\n
6/10\n
My only MAJOR complaint is the characters. If they were better, I would give this anime a higher rating. The characters are what make or break an anime. If the characters aren't good, the anime is most likely not going to be that good.

Story (7): To be honest the story reminds me of Battle Royale but it's your basic survival game. You know the survival game set up, you go alone, find a team, dominate the game, face trust issues among your team, disband, re-group, betrayal, ending. That's all I basically have to say.
Art (8): Very clean, and very good character design there are some times where I think peoples faces look weird and look like fish. But other than that it was pretty good. The thing I like the most about the anime was the color pallet very bright colors and I love bright colors.
Sound (7): Tobe honest I wasn't paying much attention to the sound I don't even remember what OP or ED sound like, but the jungle sounded like the jungle and the bombs sounds like bombs so  I can't complain.


Character (8): The characters were pretty good, things weren't the way they seemed until you really got the see the backgrounds of all the other characters every character had their own background story and they weren't those background stories where is like cry for me. They were real.


Enjoyment (8): I watched this anime with my friend and we are very very into anime so we basically finished it in the same day we watched it I didn't enjoy it in the beginning because to me all survival games are the same, then I started to learn about the characters which is normally my favorite part and the background stories were amazing it connected me to the characters so I found myself caring for them and laughing with them.


(Overall may contain a spoiler)


Overall (7): It would have been higher but my friend made this anime sound like the greatest thing. The final episode is what made me really dislike this anime I know that romance is a strong emotional thing that is in most shows and anime but in a survival game, I like to keep it "Can we just be friends" I don't like when people seek love in this dangerous situation. In real life would you really be looking for a girlfriend while everyone around you is trying to kill you? But I did my best to judge it fairly and gave it a 7.

this is my first review and i think i chose a good anime to start with. btooom is just a fun anime 2 watch. 
story:
btooom isnt like all the action anime out there. sure it had the cliched "trapped on a deserted island fight to the death" scenario but it offered a twist of bombs instead of guns which i think was quite original and just interesting. also the different types of bombs also added that variety which was 1 of the many little tweaks that made this anime enjoyable. the video game based survival game upped some points as it want just random fighting.there were rules and various mothods of fighting depending on your bomb type.   8/10


art:

art was well done. Ryouta looked much better in the anime compared to the manga. the environment was drawn pretty good and there was quite some detail in the buildings. The water was great and the physics were also good. some characters were drawn better than others but not all the characters could be masterpieces. 8/10


sound:

i never really pay attention to sound in anime but judging from my overall experience, i didnt find much fault. the opening song was amazing (its my ringtone lol) and it really suit the anime. explosions were fine but it was no christian bale movie. voice acting was good. i didnt see any major problems with it. 8/10


character:

i think this is what really made this anime what it is. the characters were all unique with different backgrounds. i dont want to spoil anything but trust issues and betrayal added the extra drama in this anime. ryouta's expertise at the online game really brought out his strength though he was apprehensive about killing. his knowledge on the gameplay and various tactics he used made the action scenes seem as if he was in control even if he was losing. sanity was also tested in the characters and some handled it better than others.i really hated the bad guy and i just wanted to punch him in his face (in other words, they did a good job in establishing an antagonist) The characters had interesting backgrounds that really makes you wonder how the creators put such an ensemble on an island but nevertheless, all the characters, relevant or not all played a role in the overall enjoyment of the anime....some more annoying than others.8/10


enjoyment:

overall i really enjoyed this anime. it had me counting down each week for a new ep to come out and after every ep, i wanted more! if ur looking for a quick action anime without a heavy storyline that makes ur head explode, then btooom is a good choice. i really liked all the strategies and the thought process in the battles and the story was great. 9/10


overall:

8/10- neeeeeds a second season!!!! :)

After finding himself trapped on a mysterious island armed with several grenades that bear a great resemblance to his favorite video game protagonist must fight for his life in a death match to decide who deserves to return home.
Btooom takes the overdone idea of being trapped in a game and gives it a slight twist, making it a reality tv show that is strikingly similar to a popular game. The show was very short and the plot doesn't really go anywhere thanks to its "read the manga ending" but luckily it was very easy to transition to the manga after completing the series. I wouldn'treally recommend it unless you really like the idea of trapped in a game series but if you do plan to watch it don't expect much of any plot, character development or a special ost, just decent animation and fun violence. Also rape. Lots and lots of rape.

At first glance Btooom! It looks like a copy of Battle Royale or Greedy Games with elements of videogame but the simple plot is implemented with very strong characters and an excellent development of the script, for sure this is an anime that surprised me and that is worth to watch.
Btooom! Is a 2012 anime based on the action manga of the same name written by Junya Inoue. Produced in the studio Madhouse (Death Note, No Game No Life) and directed by Kotono Watanabe, having 12 episodes of 24 minutes. The anime shows the story of Sakamato Ryouta, one of the best players in thepopular online game Btooom, a First-Person Shooter where only bombs, known as BIMs, are allowed to defeat their enemies. However, on a certain day, he and several other people are transported to a deserted tropical island, equipped with BIMs and the radar of the game, and with this, the participants are informed that they have to kill seven other people, and get the Chips that the person owns, to be able to leave the island. And so begins the survival game.


I quite like works that deal with survival in this style, a survival game where either you kill or die, so my interest in Btooom was natural. And as simple as it is, it's interesting. First that the protagonist is not a teenager, which is very rare, but rather is a NEET of 22 years addicted to games, and on the island have to use his knowledge for this. So, this thing of transporting real-life game knowledge is not usually true, but in this case it is valid, after all, the game is exactly the same as the online game, so his addiction to the game proves useful.


As for the story of the anime itself, it's nothing too complicated or you have to cite too much, it's a survival game, what else do you need to know? Well, in this game he makes partnerships to survive more, but each person needs 7 more chips beyond his own to leave the island. Anyway, we see the protagonist trying to survive this bloodthirsty game. But unfortunately, the anime does not complete anything well, because the end is very open, since it covered only where the manga had gone until then, then ends at the end of an arc, but not at the end of the game itself, which A little disappointed. And no, there's almost no chance of a continuation in anime, unfortunately.


But the most important thing here is the fun watching this anime, which is pretty big, at least for those who, like me, really like survival animes. The anime leads well the battles and the deaths are several, besides that the whole climate of survival pleases enough, then, however much the end does not please, the anime generates an entertaining tension during him all, which is very good.


I spoke well of the protagonist before, but now I'm going to talk about him too, because he's practically the only one who is afraid to kill others, with that idea that it's wrong and everything, good, wrong is, but it's killing or Die, and he prefers to run away and almost die to it. This is a light spoiler, but it's good for me to talk about him, since he has this problem for me. But in general he is an intelligent protagonist, and he survives more for intelligence than even protagonism.


About the rest of the cast, a girl is the other protagonist, and she is an interesting character, especially for what she has suffered in the past, but again suffers from too much altruism. Beyond it, several survivors are presented, but I do not believe all, and some are interesting, but almost none have a great development to be quoted.


Speaking of technical aspects, the animation is high level, we're talking about Madhouse, their animation hardly disappoints. As for the direction, it is a good direction, it does not impress, but it does not leave anything to be desired, and considering that it is the only work to date that this director has worked, that is good. Soundtrack is good but not very striking.


In short, Btooom! Is an excellent survival anime, with a consistent story, with an ending that leaves you wanting to be too open but with great fun.

(I try to keep my reviews short and sweet and straight to the point without giving away spoilers with that said lets get this show on the road)
This anime had so much potential to break out from the pack. It could have been another attack on titan outburst. However there are certain key characteristics that makes each anime a work of art. 
Story line- The story line is original however was not completed in this short 12 episode anime. It just stopped half way through which was totally disappointing. 
Art & Sound were both good
Character- There was no real character development (it's only 12 episodes).Also most characters were left as a mystery. Nonetheless, I did understand each character and motivations behind everything they did. \n\n
This anime has \n
Gore (People being blown up/ killed for survival)\n
Romance ( Nothing to heavy to overthrow the main point of the anime)\n
Action (Fighting for survival)\n
HEAVY SEXUAL THEMES (IN CERTAIN POINTS RAPE WAS SUGGESTED)\n

Forgive me, but this is my first review I've actually written out about an anime; but this one just pissed me off so much that I just felt the need to express my opinion on it. The show tries to damn hard to be edgy, and dark but it fails so much. First I will start off in saying that this show has basically the some of same story elements from SAO, No Game No Life, Konosuba, and Is it Wrong to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon. Most(if not all) came after Btooom! but at least they did it right(ok maybe not SAO, butI think it was OK).


Characters:3

Himiko- The Feminist Poster-Child: The girl who thinks all men are out to rape her. I suppose that would make her a pretty good character, if they had actually decided to make her the strong independent woman she started out to be; but that is needless to say, not what we have here. Not spoiling the story(too much) for people who haven't seen the show, but something happened that made all of her friends hate her despite it not being her fault at all. Let's just say it involved rape. After this event they chose to send her into this game. After which, she is almost raped herself, and decides that all men are her enemy in this game. In the end she relies solely upon Sakamoto, completely disregarding what little character she had to begin with. It's like if this shows developers wanted to make an even bitchier version of Asuna from SAO- and she probably can't even cook.



Sakamoto- Neet Gamer Cliche. He is this shows equivalent of Sora from No Game No Life, or Kirito from SAO(I should stop comparing...). He's that dude who was a shut-in gamer from one world, who is taken to another world where he is suddenly gifted and actually can contribute something to the world. The only thing about this show is how much of a fucking dumbass this guy is. The dude has to be the absolute densest motherfucker I have ever seen in anime. He is also like a hypocritical spiderman/batman. He says he isn't gonna kill, but then he will, then he tries, then he doesn't... it's just really dumb. There really isn't much to say about him, he's just a cliche of the Guy-who-gets-transported-to-another-world genre which I have seen at least 7 different times. 


For the rest of the supporting cast I will just list off my nicknames for them, and once you watch the show you will figure out exactly who they are mearly from the name. We have; Daddy Issues, Everyone's Weird Uncle, The Fonz Wannabe, Basic Bitch, Token Black Guy #1, Token Black Guy #2, Papa Bear, Obvious Bad Guy, and Female Jack Skellington.


Story:4

Like I said, it starts off pretty much like Konosuba(SAO, No Game No Life, ReZero.... is there an actual name for this kind of story?) Where the dude gets taken to another world that turns his life upside down. I would like to say that at least 20% of the story is due to some of the characters own stupidity, but I will let you decide that for yourself. The story really is nothing special, except for one thing- It doesn't have an ending. I watched 12 episodes for some kind of closure, and all I got was cock-blocked and disappointed that I had wasted 3 hours of my day. It was at this point that I decided to write this review. The ending(or lack-thereof) alone is why you have this garbage review to read.


Animation:5

I would say it was somewhere between meh, and OK. It's really nothing special in my opinion. I have certainly seen better, but I have also seen a lot worse.


Sound: Same as the Animation, nothing really special about it. I'm not a sound geek, so I'm not really picky.



My Personal Enjoyment: 1

I kept on waiting for something that I hadn't seen before, and I didn't get anything. The story is as cliche as the characters. That being said, the best way i can describe is if Michael Bay had an autistic baby with Reki Kawahara.

There was absolutely nothing about the show I can say I enjoyed.

Not much to say the series just simply about killing each other with bomb. There is a game called BTOOOM!, its successfully sold in a large amounts and so famous among societies. There is no thing such as age to be an issue here. Whether it's a kid, adolescents, and adults are loving it.
    But wait!, it's not just a simple game about bombing each other in the first place. The dirty business behind all of this revealed when the main character, Ryouta Sakamoto dragged into a deserted island. He realized a pouch of 8 bombs timer type added to his belongingsand a gem planted on his left hand out of the blue. The rules is simple, collect 8 gem and the helicopter will come to pick you up which means you need to stop other hearts from its beating permanently for the sake of collecting the gems, in short, kill people you meet in the island. The truth begins to burst; their real life now depends on their desire and skill to survive.


    The plot is not a freshly-baked in anime industry. Well you must be named few other similar series with the same theme fluently. The main idea itself is not something I'm surprised about, but the progress of its story is well-done. (Still it's unique for its boom). I like how the story slowly turns into a magnificent dark sense, and (somewhat) gore scenes to satisfy my interest. Mostly other series will edit it to reduce the terror of blood such as make it blur with black tint or other methods (I really hate this one), or even cut the scenes so it can progress to the next scene. We can find even slightly, the gore feelings here and that's what the anime maintain I guess.


    That aspect I stated above also related to my enjoyment as a whole in visual aspect. Aside from the gore scenes presented, the effect is good too. Well; for me the character designs feel a bit blowzy (maybe because it's quite seinen so the details are not the matter:) I don't know why but I have a feeling the core of enjoyment are the bombs and everyone's strategy. The bombs are vary (I like it lol) and the tactics aren't just a childish game which is easy to guess.


    The OP song here is absolutely the BTOOOM! series charm, sung by nano "No Pain, No Game" is rock n' roll! It seems the last ep, ep 12, is quite special because the OP song is changed still sung by Nano "Exist". And The ED song is sadly not supporting enough "Aozora (アオゾラ)" by May'n.



For the enjoyment throughout the show plus the songs, and other aspects related,

I decide to give the series rate 8.

Pros;

OP songs & Insert Songs

The enjoyment

Strategy & those thrilling bombs


Cons;

Average design characters

Each characters aren't too developed

Ok so here comes my review for BTOOOM!
Story 6/10
Originality is obviously lacking lol. It doesn't mean the subject of a Battle Royale-ish story isn't interesting anymore, but sometimes I kinda feel like they are copying some parts of Battle Royale, especially the part with the cheerful guy instructing the rules to the players on the screen. I know you guys will have to agree with me about this.
So at some parts the story is really promising. But it is just predictable. In many fighting scenes I was like "Oh I think he is going to do this and then she is going to do that"and yeah, like a magic *maybe not* that is exactly how the scene proceeded. Even when it is not predictable, it is not GENIUS, not something you would go "WOW I CAN"T BELIEVE THEY CAN THINK UP THAT!" Many strategies in this anime are totally random, like the writer was suffering writer's block or smt so he decided to invent some ridiculous way for his characters to get out of the situation.


And the FAN SERVICE oh the FAN SERVICE I get that many of the viewers are males but I freaking hate those fan services focusing on Himiko's boobs, soo annoying, take away all the excitement of the shows.

Sound 7/10

I love the OP and actually I decided to watch BTOOOM! based on the OP only, the song is so good, especially when it goes "The game has only just begun"! The rest of the soundtrack isn't anything outstanding but they fit the anime.


Character 3/10

Hahahaha.

The characters.


First we have the main character Sakamoto, who I really like. BUT it is only because he is sooo bad ass, but only sometimes, and also because I like his design so much. Himoko. That girl. She almost never does anything useful instead of looking good. She is kinda annoying. And her background story? The rest of the cast: They have ABSOLUTELY NO DEPTH. And yeah 


*SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER

 I hate it when they depicted Taira-san as an asshole at the end of the anime when he has so much potential to be an ass-kicking sidekick of Sakamoto ._. The fact that he turns into a bad guy is so predictable 

SPOILER ENDSSSSSSSSSSSS*


The other people are not given any back-ground story and they lack dimensions in their personalities and they are stupid, really stupid.


Enjoyment 6/10

It is given a generous score of 6 due to the fact that I highly enjoyed the first 4 or 5 episodes before the anime turns into something really cliche.


So overall 6/10. Go watch it if you are a very big fan of this kind of survival game, but in my opinion it is just ok, nothing really special.

BTOOOM! (12 Episodes)
Rating: 5/10 (Average)
Recommendation Level: Skip It
With a promising first episode, BTOOOM seemed to have a lot to offer. Until you realize it's faults.
Story:
Ryota, 22 years of age, lives at home with his parents. Doesn't have a job and plays a video game called BTOOOM all day, everyday. He's in the top ten of the best players and a king at the game. Then one day, Ryota awakes on an island, armed with only bombs. As he progresses forward, Ryota soon comes to realize that he's playing BTOOOM, for real.
Oh...the plot. BTOOOM has so much promise but it just doesn't execute very well. Alot of the story is bogged down with meandering dialogue and over the top conflicts. The anime tries to take itself to serious and that's where it starts to fall apart. Instead of being a dumb fun anime, it wants to be a drama. Sometimes it works, but more times than not, it fails do to its weak structure of characters.


Characters:


Ryota: Douche.


Himiko: Almost useless.


Everyone else: The show doesn't care, so I don't care.


To be fair, Ryota makes the most progress. Without him, BTOOOM would be a lost cause. Ryota makes changes on his life decisions and comes to realize how important his actions are and what life really is about. Himiko, why couldn't she be better?


Himiko is a damsel in distress. Granted, she does do things on her own but Ryota almost has to save her at every turn. Now this just may be me, but when you have an action based anime, I always feel your lead lady characters should be strong in some way. Either cunning, good with weapons, good at fighting, et cetera. When you have a damsel, it becomes really distracting and it bogs down the anime every turn. Ryota always has to carry the majority of the load when it comes to their lives being at stake. At least Ryota and Himiko have some chemistry together. So, that's good.


Animation & Sound:


The animation can be pretty decent at times. The action scenes are well done and the softer moments aren't awful to look at. Which is disappointing because the action scenes can be very far and in-between and those are the best parts of BTOOOM.


The music, besides the first opening, is okay. The first opening is the strong point. It really kicks the anime into gear and gives a lot of hope going into the next episode. 


The dub, is actually pretty good. Besides Himiko's voice, which when I heard who it was, I knew what I was getting from it, everyone else is pretty solid. It seems they took time to find a good cast to suck more viewers in. I can respect that.


Overall:


If BTOOOM spent more time trying to be stupid, it'd be a lot better. As of now, none of the drama elements really work because of the ending. And not trying to give away too much but the ending is one of those "There should be a season 2 coming. There isn't? Okay. Go read the manga." The final episode really kills the overall appeal of the show when you realize that BTOOOM spent more time trying to create a drama like atmosphere, when there was no confirmation of a second season, and not just go all out ridiculous with its plot. 


With all that being said, some of you may really like the anime's direction. It may lead you to read the manga and see how it ends. For me, I'm not anticipating on reading the manga. The show comes off with good ideas, it just wasn't executed very well.

This anime is AMAZING. That's it. You can close this tab now, open another, go to google, type Btooom episode 1 and watch it. If you are still reading you are probably wondering why is it amazing and you should so i will tell you.
(story) The anime is about a guy named Sakamoto Ryouta. He is an unemployed loser that plays a specific video game all day long. That game is called Btooom. He is the best player in japan and he is very well known in the Btooom world. He is famous and he even has a girlfriend in the gamethat he never met in real life. But one day he wakes up in an strange island with a bag of bombs and some food. He can't remember anything and he is worried about what to do and where to go. So he decides to search the island for any survivors. After walking for quite some time he meets another person. Happy to meet someone he rushes towards him and the guy that he met attempts to kill him. After he survived this attack he finds out that some people are trying to recreate the Btooom game in the real world and the only way to leave the island is to kill 7 other people. Will he survive this twisted version of the game? 


(Visuals) Visually it is beautiful. The charachters look amazing and the explosions look really nice. The characters are well detailed and the colors are lively and bright.


(Sound) It also sounds great and the opening songs are catchy and nice. The voice actors did a great job in making you feel like they are in danger. But there some voices actors that couldn't represent the character they should really well but it wasn't too noticeable.


I really enjoyed this anime and i believe a lot of people would. Since i LOVE survival anime i enjoyed it a lot and i had a wonderful time watching it.  If you have some free time i think you should watch it because you will enjoy it.

The story takes place in modern day society and an extremely popular bombimg game has been released, called Btooom. The main character is extremely good at it and ends up being the 10th best player in the world.
But it doesnt just stop there, the story then takes off into an isolated island with no food or water, just a group of 30 or so people. They are forced to kill eachother for the win to get out of there and survive with the exact same comcept of the Btooom game. 
A life and death situation, 8 bombs, people out to kill you, how else canyou survive other than to kill before you be killed.


The story in this series is extremely entertaining, and you also have your little harem romance, so this anime really delivers.


The art is similar to death note in that its very detailed, and blood is shown quiet allot throughout the series.


The main character kind of reminds me of kirito from SAO in that hes really good at gaming, and uses his gaming skills to survive.

The main character girl is of course a real hotty, but isnt very good at survival, in the game and in real life, but there is something special about her that you later on find out in the story.

The rest of the characters have many different personalities, u have a pshychotic kid, a greedy lawyer, a frightened family man, a mercinary, and so on and so forth...


Enjoyment, 10, because you have so much going on in the story that it makes you want to continue watching it, at least thats what I found myself doing. 


Overall, very entertaining and just something nice to watch if you feel like watching a quick 12 eps anime with some violence.

Basically, a show which features a survival game with the usage of bombs and an embedded chip on their hand to serve as a radar to find other people. Apparently, the people who were selected to go to this island were loathed by the close people they knew for various reasons. 
Story
+ Various sub stories of the characters of how they were chosen by their closed friends.
+ Tries it best to execute the reality of how it would be like to be stranded in an island, for instance, people get desperate in certain conditions, the inability to trust anyone you just saw etc.
+ Ending hada lot of unexplained points, with room for a second season definitely.\n\n
Art\n
+ Artwork was pretty okay with obvious bias towards the main characters but nothing that would deter people. I felt it was dark at certain parts though.\n\n
Sound\n
+ Voice actors were fitting as one could feel the anxiousness, nervousness and their various feelings.\n
+ Background music were fitting for the atmosphere.\n\n
Character\n
+ Really liked how the main character has "grown". For instance, he understands how\n
+ Liked Himiko as well, she's not stupid and notices things.\n
+ Felt a bit of pity for one of the characters who gave in to despair, could have been a different outcome/ending, but I do not blame him at all..\n
+ Disliked one character extremely for his betrayal of someone who trusted him, would have liked him to be given justifiable punishment to be honest. \n\n
Enjoyment\n
+ Liked how the battles between certain indivivuals turned out, whilst some were predictable, there were some which weren't. \n
+ Would love to see a second season because it simply isn't complete in the sense that it has a lot of holes to fill but regardless, it started off well if this is meant to be the first season.

You are now in life or death situation how do you cope? Well for me I would crawl up in a ball and cry but that's not what people in this anime do oh now lets fully examine this anime known as Btooom!
Story=7 
Granted I have seen many versions of this plot but that doesn't stop it from having a unique take on it. I love seeing how there are different situations and how the main characters deal with it even though the solution involves blowing shit up. This is a battle royal style anime with Video games being involved (PC Master race all theway). So we have Sakamoto a NEET who likes to play a video game known as 'Btooom' and boy is he good at it, I mean really good. Heck he ranks number 10 in the world. One day he wakes up on an island to discover that his favourite game is to be played in real life. Although everybody thinking that just because he is amazingballs at the game that he can make this through alright. That is particularly correct he doesn't die or anything I mean what do you expect he is the main character after all. But this is also psychological on the player as in real life killing someone is a hard decision to make in real life than it is in a video game. So seeing that being represented in this anime is a plus instead of them just going for the Shounen route and blowing up each others asses (instead it is there body parts and internal organs :) ). Every character has a backstory to make us feel either sympathy or a fill in into why they would be in this terrible situation so don't expect each character to have backstory because with the amount of characters that we see we wouldn't have one for them but that's not a massive issues as I really didn't like most of them anyways. You will get the occasion fan service (as well as rape on the side but nothing too graphical) which to me doesn't take away from the story I would go far as to say that it helps it out nothing high school of the dead style but still we get boobs with a bra holding on to them (not like we haven't seen enough of those already). Which kinda helps sell the idea of how bad Himiko had it. Overall fast paced for 12 episodes but no too quick that you don't miss out on anything. 

The one thing I had bad about it is that is ended on a massive cliff hanger and wanted me too see how our characters continued to progress on wards. 


Art=7

Boy did this remind me a lot like the art style in Deathnote oh wait maybe because that guy who did Deathnote also did the art style for Btooom. The contrast in blue and green will not surprise you in why they look similar. The art on the island was up to how anime standards go but I feel like the animation budget went in that than where the characters lived in the city but like we care about the city they live in we want to see the insects and animals and bloody hell a lot of explosions. Aw yes the explosions if you are a muscular man just like myself you will love the explosions but if you want dialect so that the characters do not to kill each other,GET OUT NOW! Back to subject the animation on the explosions look like what explosions would look in the anime world. The design one the characters were generic to the big boobed to a Light Yagami looking mothertrucker (hint look back at beginning to see why)and long angle shots made the trees and plants look more like my sketch book from when I was 7(Hint I wasn't good at drawing) The shading at times was off putting at times but hey I'm crazy so don't bother making sense of it. Animation on the opening was freaking amazing like a child on LSD and went well in partying what we the audience was about to see. Then there is the ending animation which put everything into a calm manner and relaxed us from the epicenes that we had preciously had seen.                          

BRIGHT FUNNY COLOURS FOR THE KIDS!


Sound=8 

Opening song 'No Pain No Game' by Nano defiantly suited it ( I love Nano's work) and made me hyped to see the next episode. This is one the openings that I would not skip but instead watch as the song and the opening animation suited each other in a passionately way, like chocolate and Pepsi (weird combination I know) the rest of the soundtrack created a hyped or dramatic atmosphere and there was never a comedy moment to break the tension (if there was I didn't find it funny) and all music was serous apart from the ending song. As preciously mentioned about the ending animation it applies to the ending song as well making calm and peaceful. They then changed the opening song on the last episode and as many people complain about op songs changing I found this to be to my liking and thought it went really well with it as it was produced by the same band (go check out Nano's works they are good). 


Characters=6 

Ok before I start writing this I would like to point out that some of the characters DIE or DONT HAVE AN EXCEPTABLE BACKSTORY for me to consider them to be of an importance so if I don't mention them then they haven't really been that important apart from being killed. 

Ryōta Sakamoto who is a Neet and depends on his parents money to live and lives with them as well. He is as stated previously an amazingballs player of the game Btooom. During intense battles he can change from his normal self to his I'm going to kill you mode but that doesn't get shown a lot of the time. He started out as a dick but as we progress through out the story we see a much more different side to him (not his I'm going to kill you mode but his caring mode). Sakamoto does not ever leave his friends when they are in danger (but he will if they are injured...weird) and cares for trying to leave the island without killing. It is nice to see such a strong willed character to do so. 


Himiko who is a highschool student with a tragic backstory about how her friends hated her (hint has nothing to do with getting them raped) and spends most if not all of her time playing Btooom. She then meets Sakamoto online and the get internet married but when they meet in real life its not the why they planned on meeting each other also as a side note she really hates men and I mean REALLY HATES MEN with a passion but if you saw what she had to go through than you could sympathise with her for doing so. But Sakamoto is the only male she trusts on the island and would protect him to the very end they share a strong love for each other (inset twilight joke here you unoriginal person) but don't know that they are meant to be until the last episode. 


Kōsuke Kira 

(No Deathnote reference here) Kira is a 14 year old boy convicted of doing terrible terrible things to not only people but his family as well (although what happened with his dad was acceptable as I thought of his father to be an asshole) he plays this game without thinking about human life making him a dangerous person to be up against. 


A few mentionable characters are Kiyoshi Taira who is another member in Sakamoto's group who doesn't really serve much of a purpose in the series but plays a big part in the final episode. Then there is Sakamoto's childhood friend Nobutaka Oda who him and Sakamoto had a disagreement on which led to them both being expelled from school and plays no massive part apart from the battle scene with him and Sakamoto but even then it could have been a totally random character and it would still have the same affect although I suppose the writers were looking for some emotional backstory to give Sakamoto and that's why Nobutaka was introduced. Also not going to lie he is one badass mothertrucker. 


there's not much I can write now the only negative that I can see in this series is of the characters and the cliff hanger at the end although I here the manga is still continuing so if you want to see how the story progresses go read that. I could only stream this as it is not available on DVD in Britain. 


Now remember kids don't stay indoors playing video games all day you might end up just being in one yourself. That has been my review and a recommendation for you to watch it because it is good.

Before I go into the specifics I would like to say one thing. All of these are my own beliefs and I do not expect anyone to completely agree with them or agree with them at all. But as a person who have watched almost all genre of anime, and countless number of shows (I do not really feel like adding all to my profile), I believe my opinion may help someone who has trouble deciding "Btoom!" is worth their time or not. 
*This review is spoiler free.
Story:
First lets talk about the story on the surface. It is quite simple. Kill, survive, go home.Sadly, the over arcing story is far to simple to be interesting. However, character's back stories have been done very nicely. The underlying message is much heavier. It talks mainly about evil acts humans are capable of.  When placed in a desperate situation, people are willing to go as far as murdering another human being. There are multiple situations where characters have the choice to kill or flee. Most choose to kill. Of course the show is set in an extreme situation, but the message saying that everyone is capable of evil is prominent and realistic. With a nice mix of these, the story line is enticing due to its complex yet simple nature. 


*Show ends off making you want to kill yourself though. 


Characters:

The first episode would make anyone want to punch the main character in the face for being so stupid. But other than that, the character developments were done quite phenomenally. Interesting back stories and significant changes in their personalities throughout the show makes every single character likable in some way. 


Enjoyment:

It just like Steins;gate. It starts off incredibly slow. But once it hits the climax, you will not be able to stop watching the show. It was one of the most addicting shows I have watched in 2013.


Do I recommend it?

I highly recommend it! Even though the ending will make you want to

It's kind of interesting how hard it is to make good survival game anime, there really aren't that many out there that are good. I've made my opinions clear on "Future Diary" and "Juuni Taisen", and they both show why survival game anime are extremely difficult to make properly. "Btooom!" is another such example. 
Going into it, the idea of the anime seems pretty promising. I mean yeah, it's a survival game, nothing too interesting about that, but the whole premise seemed pretty unique. Whereas "Future Diary" and "Juuni Taisen" have willing and knowledgeable participants, every competitor in "Btooom!" has participants that were unwillingly kidnappedand brought onto an island. However, the creativity stops there. Let me just go through a few of the things that made me dislike this anime as whole. 


On a positive note though:


Art:

The art is actually pretty damn stunning. Coming from Madhouse, this isn't really a surprise. Watching it, you really feel yourself immersed into this jungle-like island. The animation on the leaves is vivid and gorgeous, the rivers look bright and refreshing, each character has a really clean design, etc. Hell, the animators even took every liberty to make the scales on a lizard realistic. Like the animators took a ton of dedication into making it look good.


Sound:

The sound is damn awesome too. The music during the actions scenes either gives you a feeling of dread, suspense, adrenaline or an odd combination of the three. Not to mention that the opening is fantastic. Not my favorite, but it definitely set the tone the show tried to establish. Key word: Tried.


Story and Characters:

Using that I'll segue into my next section, arguably the weakest part of the show was the story and the characters as a whole. Don't let this anime fool you, its beauty is skin deep. 


The story begins by introducing the audience to the protagonist, Ryouta Sakamoto who is a NEET and top Btooom! player, being the best in Japan and #10 in the world. One day, he wakes up to discover that he's on an island, and rapidly figures out something is wrong.


Won't go into any more detail since I think the rest is pretty self explanatory. The story tries to take itself too seriously. It has so much potential to be an interesting and thought-provoking series, but falls flat on the multitudinous problems that you see throughout the run of the show. 


Firstly, this is a world in which the laws of physics don't apply. If a bomb is thrown at a remotely important character, their plot armor kicks in and they magically make it out alive. When the same bomb is thrown in the exact same way at a character no one cares about, nope, sorry, you're dead. Like honestly, this got to be such a contrived part of the series. The majority of primary protagonists and antagonists find some convoluted and complicated way out of avoiding BIMs, even if realistically there's no possible way that anyone could possibly survive, much less dodge a bomb like that. What makes zero sense is that even if you are lucky enough to avoid a bomb, you will either die or be severely impaired or incapacitated from the g-force of the bomb alone. In wars, the majority of grenade related deaths are either due to shrapnel, or the g-force of the explosion shattering skulls. So many of the characters feel immortal with the way they're able to avoid death without a scratch. "Thank God there was this rock that appeared out of nowhere to shield me from the blast!" This series has so much Deus ex Machina, it feels like something out of "Future Diary" (sorry not sorry). I'd be willing to forgive all of that if the series concluded properly, but no. The ending is a total cliffhanger, and based on the idea that there likely won't be a second season, this is all we have.


The characters are even worse. I have hated virtually every single character in this anime aside from maybe one or two. Ryouta is such a confusing character, at least in personality. He's a total dick to his parents, but suddenly changes to this virtuous protector on the island. And even his tactfulness varies greatly on the island too. Either he's unbelievably brilliant and cunning, or has no damn clue what he's doing. He's supposedly this amazing player, so how it took him multiple tries to understand how the timer BIMs worked was beyond me. His design, while clean, lacks any sort of creativity. He kinda looks like Light Yagami crossed with a harem protagonist. 


Himiko isn't any better. While the concept of having someone go through trauma and attempted rape in the past, and then having to adapt to a survival game environment is really interesting, the writers did almost nothing with it. She's also apparently a pretty good player in Btooom! too. She could have been this amazing contender, but was reduced to another typical damsel in distress. Another thing that bothered me about her character was her distrust of men. No doubt what she went through was horrible, but to make a scathing generalization about ALL men was just ridiculous. I mean she's put in a ton of compromising situations where someone might have their way with her, so I don't blame her on that. What I DO blame her for is that she distrusts Ryouta, but sticks around with him and Taira anyway. Like she doesn't bother to trek out on her own and attempt to live off the land, which would have been a really cool deviation from the norm. She doesn't even try to find another woman either. I also disliked how the writers and designers put in fanservice at really inappropriate moments. A good chunk of the time, whenever we see her body is when she's being assaulted, which was both distasteful and appalling. The other time fanservice was shown was when Ryouta walked in on her bathing in the river; she screams pervert of course, because why not? Even when it isn't Ryouta's fault, like when she walks out of a shower and runs into him, he's still somehow the pervert. 


Almost all of the other characters are pretty bad too. Pretty much because they either fall into the "this person is a dick" or "this person is insane" tropes, which is to be expected. Like, almost none of them are sane when they get on the island. Kousuke Kira is one such vile character. I don't care how you try to defend him. Saying he's crazy because "his dad abused him" is such a lazy excuse for both writing and defense of the character. His dad is a horrible, horrible person don't get me wrong, but when you kill and rape women (in that order btw) THREE times by the time you're fourteen, there's some underlying psychotic mental disorder that abusive parenting can't be solely responsible for. 


The lawyer and doctor characters are also awful people. The lawyer is a sleazy excuse for a human being who represents the Kiras. The doctor manipulates the good(?) nature of Ryouta by healing Taira, only to turn around and unsurprisingly betray him and Himiko by attempting to kill them with remote control BIMs. Not to mention this isn't his first rodeo either, he was on the island before, and betrayed his lover not once, but TWICE in the span of their background. Almost everyone else is a bit character that no one could bother to care about, or as I mentioned previously: insane, a dick, or an insane dick. 


The people back home aren't any better either. Ryouta is sent into the game by his mother of all people. He was terrible son, but going as far to make him disappear? Are you serious? And what about Himiko's friends? In one of Himiko's backstories, we discover that she just barely managed to escape a "party" in which three of her friends were raped. What do her friends do to thank her for contacting the police when there was literally nothing else she could do? They all unanimously agree to send her in, despite having literally no reason to. "Yeah, she didn't want to get raped, and there was nothing she could have done to help us, so she escaped with her life and went to the police." What a bitch amirite? This was another point of contention I had for Himiko's character. It's made perfectly clear she doesn't like men, but she had absolutely no trust problems with girls despite the fact that THREE WOMEN were responsible for sending her into the game.


The only two characters I ended up liking where Taira and Shiki (No, she wasn't actually a shiki, but how cool would that have been?). Taira is pretty much the only character to have a fleshed out background, and is a pretty good-natured, down to earth man. He even totally understands why he was in the game. He's not your typical cocky bastard who has no damn clue why he was sent there. Shiki is also a cool character too, having survived the first game, only to come face-to-face with the man who stabbed her in the back twice. Unfortunately, she doesn't get much time and there isn't much more to her character, which is a shame because she's really interesting and mysterious, and I want to get to know more about her.


These two, the sound and the attention to detail in the animation are the only reasons this score is a five and not a four. "Btooom!" had so much wasted potential, and instead chose to go with a trope-filled plot with detestable characters.

There is no, and never will be, an ending. That should be everything you need to know about this. 
But it says I need to write a needlessly longer review. 
The story was OK. The MC was both a genius, and an idiot. I found it hard to get over the glaring contradiction of that. At times he would have unmatched insight, at other times he was more dense than your average teenager. And no, I'm not talking about romance.
If the series went on it could have lead to some exciting battles, but the author decided not to show any yet, save one or two.I suppose his idea was to do that much later on and keep the MC a pacifist as long as possible. \n\n
It does touch on some more mature themes and do so alright in terms of realism. \n\n
But again, none of this matters as it has no plans on ever finishing. There is no ending nor resolution.

Story & Writing:
Btoom's writing is nothing short of an offensive joke. It's so shallow, pretentious, and utterly devoid of personality that I do not hesitate to compare it to Sword Art Online , if that gives you an idea. 
First off, the characters are extremely one-dimensional and horribly developed. Most of them are hackneyed "villains" who embody what this show would like to unironically call "human nature," betraying everyone they meet and thinking only about themselves. What's worse is that Btooms takes itself seriously and seems to expect the audience to agree with its laughable message, one akin to what a 12 year old wouldcome up with after listening to one too many Linkin Park songs.


Every single character who is not the protagonist will always be reduced to either a Saturday cartoon villain or a sex object. This would be somewhat tolerable if only protagonist wasn't such a braindead cookie-cutter self-insert jackass who, due to his "game experience," is the smartest and most formidable player on the island. He never loses a duel and can never die. He is protected by so many layers of plot armor that no conflict that involves him ever feels substantial or interesting, because nothing is ever at stake. Did this extensive description remind you a certain other overpowered protagonist from another anime? Well, that's exactly my point. 


But it does not end there.


The plot started as a somewhat interesting action thriller but slowly devolved into a parody of itself. First of all, the "battle of wits" are made to look very dramatic and intense but in the end they all boil down to wacky deus ex machinas and very basic strategies that are not as clever as Btooom thinks. Secondly, the bare-bones romance subplot between the protagonist and the heroine is purely unneeded and nothing short of cringy. This is when the self-insert undertones really creep to the surface, reducing Btooom's writing to nothing but masturbation fodder for male audiences.  


And worst of all, Btoom has a very uninformed and oftentimes sleazy obsession with misogyny and rape culture. It's like the writer learned everything he knew about misandry, androphobia, and rape culture from the first two paragraphs of a fucking wikipedia page. Btoom treats rape as if it's just a fact of life, as if it just happens and victims of rape should just move on, should just forget about any physical, mental, or emotional trauma inflicted on them in the process. Btoom's message is neither sympathetic nor complex. It just uses rape as an easy cop-out plot device to pull edgy backstories out of its own asshole. But then again, I would at least tolerate this offense if Btooom didn't approach the issue so shadily and lecherously.


To give you an example, a character was nearly raped twice.

You'd think the show would exhibit some degree of sympathy towards her, right? Show her compassion and maybe put her in more comfortable situations? 

Nope. Btoom proceeds to sexualize the fuck out of her, frequently showing shots of her in her underwear and actively puts her in very sexually provocative poses. It also does this very scummy thing where it treats her like she's stupid and crazy for being distrustful of men after her traumatic experience. By the end of the show, she is reduced to just a powerless sex object whose only purpose is to get into trouble and be rescued by the oh-so-heroic protagonist. Once again, deja vu? Shit Fart Online vibes? I don't believe in coincidences.


tldr:

Basically, what I've described is the scope of what this dogshit show can do with its writing. Truly a travesty. A completely predictable, shallow, edgy tryhard story with piss poor execution and obscene character writing.


Art:

Madhouse does good work, but sadly that effort is wasted on this pile of dung disguised as a "story"


Sound: 

Mediocre. Nothing memorable.


Enjoyment: 

3/10


Overall: 

3/10

Fuck you Btooom. You're neither deep, thrilling, nor clever. You're just glorified self-insert wank bank material.
